dialogues.text: A door in front of a cliff.  You're driving yourself over  the edge. You need to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop? How can I stop? I'm  this close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bug doesn't only  destroy computers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what it did to your  computer. Look what it's doing  to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's killing you. Leave it  unknown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Clarity)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were afraid of  it. That's why you quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, I got burnt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Sol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It caused my stroke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit. It's  math, numbers, ideas.  Mathematicians are suppose to  be out on the edge. You  taught me that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, there's more than  math! There's a whole world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where discoveries  happen. We have to go out  there alone, all alone, no  one can accompany us. We have  to search the edge. We have  to risk it all. But you ran  from it. You're a coward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, it's death!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stands up and screams down at Sol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't tell me what it  is. You don't know You've  retreated to your goldfish,  to your books, to your Go,  but you're not satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sol grabs his cane and whacks the Go board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out! Max, get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to understand it.  I want to know! Sol swings his cane as Max heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max paces on a downtown train as it pulls into 42nd Stree Through the open doors, Max notices a YOUNG PHOTOGRAPHER jeans and a leather jacket photographing him from the upt platform. Max is enraged and screams at him. The man ducks behind a column, but a few moments later he's back snapping pictur The doors start to shut, but Max uses his body to get off the train. The Photographer sees him coming and flees. Max follows the man's movement on his platform. When the man shoots up the exit stairs, Max does so as well. Max catches a glimpse of his foe entering the catacombs  heading toward Times Square. Max pursues. Max chases him down a looooong passage. But he loses him at an underground five-way fork in the r One staircase is Uptown and Queens... another is Brooklyn...one other is unlabeled. Still enraged, Max marches forward Just then, he catches glimpse of the Photographer exiting the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the heart of New York, Max spins around searching for foe. His frustration mounts until out of the comer of his eye sees a strange reflection. Not knowing what it's of, he t around to see the source The reflection is from a giant,  brilliant stock ticker - 50 yards long and luminous. Max stares at the quotes They are hypnotizing and Max is  suddenly calm. Then, Max has a premonition. He turns and spots the  Photographer in front of a porn shop on Eighth and 42nd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max whacks the Photographer against a back-lit image of a Hustler Centerfold. The man screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you working for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photographer hands Max his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want your wallet. Who sent you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max grabs the kid's camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell sent you!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha...I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm...a...student I've got  an assignment for class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Photographer pulls out his student ID. Max looks at i Then he rips out the film-exposing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone, damn it.  Leave me alone. Max hands the man back his camera and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max heads home in a furious state. Suddenly, he sees two Marcy's men blocking his path. It's Brad and Jake, yet an tough guy, and they don't look happy. Max spins around an sees Marcy Dawson blocking his exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcy? What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max retreats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take a ride, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, I got work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks back at the tough guys who are almost on top of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a deal! NOW get in the limo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcy releases a vicious slap that nearly knocks Max down whimpers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever hit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes Marcy aside and darts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max flees. Jake and Brad charge after him. They're right him - he has a meter or so on them. He scurries through a construction site and over a footbr Then, he runs into an all-night

dialogues.speaker: BODEGA
dialogues.text: The tough guys chase after him and he gets a bit of a lead in the narrow aisles. He pleads with the owners for help - nothing doing. Jake heads him off and uses his body to block the aisle. Max grabs a can of beans and slams it down on the tough g nose. The guy goes down and Max shoots out the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max dives under a car and crawls for terror. He sees two of feet nun by. Max starts to relax when he notices a pai heels on the other side of the car. Marcy bends down and at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough, Max, c'mon out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone. I don't  know anything. Max retreats in the opposite direction. Suddenly Jake and grab him and drag him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey! Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They search him, taking his wallet, keys, everything. Marcy looks at the guys, who shake their heads. She walks to Max and shows Max the front page of the Wall Street  Journal. It reads, "MARKET CRACHES"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're responsible for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything. I  didn't play the market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcy pulls out a folded, worn piece of paper. She opens It's Max's stock pick that he threw out. Part of THE numb on the page

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to be careful  where you throw out your trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave us faulty information.  You gave us the carrot, the right  picks, but then you only gave us  part of the code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You selfish, irresponsible  cretins. How could you be so  stupid!? Marcy jabs Max in his stomach. Max falls to the ground. T tough guys sit on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Max. This isn't a  game anymore. We're playing  on a global scale. We used  your code. Foolish...I admit.  But we can fix things if we  make some careful picks. Give  us the rest of the code so  we can set things right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon! I know who you are.  You're not gonna save the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Max...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcy nods to Jake, who pulls out a gun and points it at head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Information is  the private language of Capital. We tried to  establish a symbiotic  relationship but if you choose to compete and  enter our niche we are forced  to comply with the laws of  nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max thinks for a second. Max thinks hard. He realizes be can't give them the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't kill me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Max. You  don't get it. I don't give a shit about you. I only  care about what's in your  fucking head. If you won't help  us help yourself, then I'll  have only one choice. Destroy the  competition. I'll take you  out of the game. Survival of the  fittest, Max. And we've got  the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake cocks the gun. Max starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastards! You stupid  bastards! Suddenly, Jake is whacked with a sawed-off baseball bat. He smashes into the sidewalk. It is Farrouhk, Max's neighbor, who's just pulled up in h taxicab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Spotting his savior)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrouhk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farroukh threatens Marcy and the other tough guy, who retreat in fear. Farroubk is afraid as well, so he doesn' quite leap on them. He just keeps swinging the bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sick! He's sick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max gets to his feet and runs behind Farrouhk.  Just then a station wagon screeches up to the curb. Lenny Meyer, Ephraim, and a bunch of other his burly Jews jump

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks at Farrouhk and then he looks at Lenny. Ephraim grabs Max and pulls him toward the station wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Farrouhk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrouhk heads for his cab. Ephraim helps Max into the backseat of the wagon and climbs in after him. Lenny Meyer jumps into the passenger seat and the gray-be YISRAEL slams on the gas Pedal. Farrouhk jumps into his cab.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Yisrael yanks the steering wheel to the left, the old sta wagon skids around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrouhk what about Farrouhk!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ephraim pushes Max's head down. Yisrael takes another corner sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's okay, he got  in his cab. We've been looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I have it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have it. Where is it?  You have it written down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny nods to Ephraim, who starts scanning through Max's pockets. Max resists. The other guys hold him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing!? What  the hell are you doing!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not joking  around, Max? Where's the number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pushing Ephraim away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not on me. It's in my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You memorized it?  Did you give it to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who!? Those  Wall Street bastards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just answer me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Hebrew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yisrael screeches the car to a halt. He spins around in h seat and looks Max in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dealing with something  really big now, Max. I don't  want to hurt you, so answer  me. Did you give it to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got part of it  Now get off me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it! Damn it!  They're using it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max chews into Ephraim's hand which is pinning him. Ephra screams and lets loose a punch to Max's jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Lenny is late, and Max's world - as well as ours goes black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stares suspiciously at the bathroom. He slowly picks his drill. Wielding it like a hammer, he carefully advanc into the  BATHROOM where he looks into the sink. He almost vomits w he sees a piece of human brain sitting above the drain. A swarm across its surface. Max becomes furious. He whacks it with the drill. Blood f up into his face. In a wild rage, he smashes it and punch it. Then he drops the drill and uses his bare hands to shove down the drain. Screaming like a madman, he jams it until is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wise-looking, bearded Hasidic man with benevolent, pier eyes stands tenderly over Max. He wears traditional black clothes. Lenny Meyer paces nervously in the background. As Max comes through, RAV COHEN speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, Max. You're  okay I'm Rabbi Cohen. Cohen  like you. I'm sorry for what  Lenny did, he's been  reprimanded. It is not our way  Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything will be  fine, Max. You need to give  us the number. Do you have  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Charging over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you we don't know

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't be so  flipped out if you didn't  know. What's happening to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us the number!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay! Lenny,  easy! Max, I'll tell you  what's going on. Just calm  down.  (Deep breath, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Talmud tells us it began two  thousand years ago, when the  Romans destroyed the second  temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me a chance.  You'll understand everything  if you listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max takes out his pills and starts feeding himself some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Romans also  murdered all of our priest- hoodВ—the CohanimВ—the Cohens,  and with their deaths they  destroyed our greatest  secret. In the center of the  great temple was the holy of  holies which was the heart of  Jewish life. This was the  earthly residence for our  God. The one God. It  contained the ark of the  Tabernacle which stored the  original Ten Commandments  that God gave to Moses. Only  one man could enter this  space once a year on the  holiest day of the year, Yom  Kippur On the Day of  Atonement, all of Israel  would descend upon Jerusalem  to witness the High Cohen's  trip into the holy of holies.  If the holy man was pure he  would reemerge a few moments  later and Israel was secured  a prosperous year. It meant  that we were one yea r closer  to the messianic age. Closer  to the return of the Garden  of Eden. But if he was  impure, he would die  instantly and it meant that  we were doomed. The High  Cohen had a single ritual to perform in the holy of holies.  He had to intone a single  word. Rav Cohen takes a dramatic pause. Max is anxious to hear end of the story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That word was the true name of God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The true name, which only  the Cohanim knew, was two  hundred and sixteen letters  long. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're telling me that the number in  my head is the name of God!? Wondrously, Max rubs the scar on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Passion building)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...it's The key into  the messianic age. As the  Romans burned the temple, the  Talmud says, the High Cohen  walked into the flames. He  took his secret to the top of  the burning building. The  heavens opened up and took  the key from the priest's  outstretched hand. We've been  searching for the key ever  since. And you may have found  it. Now let us find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what happened. I  saw God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, Max.  You're not pure. You can't  see God unless you're pure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more than God... it s everything. It's math  and science and nature... the universe. I saw the  Universe's DNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's much more.  We can unlock the door with  the key. It will show God  that we are pure again. He  will return us to The Garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garden? You're not pure.  I'm the one who has the  number

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think  you are? You are a vessel  from our God. You are  carrying a delivery that  needs to be made to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was given to me. It's  part of me. It's changing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's killing you.  Because you are impure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will kill you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what will it do to  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're pure. Give  us the number!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The number is nothing.  You know that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can use it. We  can wield it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a number. I'm  sure you've written down  every two hundred sixteen number.  You've translated all of  them. You've intoned them  all. Haven't you? But what's  it gotten you? It's not the  number! It's the meaning.  It's the syntax. It's what's  between the numbers. If you  could understand you would.  But it's not for you! I've  got it. I understand it. I'm  going to see it!  (Whispers to Rav Cohen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rabbi...I was chosen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max races through the streets of New York. He is wide-eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, it's all there.  It all makes sense. I  can crack it. I can know it.  I know what it is. Sol knows,  too. I need to tell him. I  need to show him. I need to  bring him with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People fly by. Max in a spiraling whirlwind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pumped and excited Max paces the hall as he rings the b The door opens. But it isn't Sol. It's a young, beautiful woman wearing a simple black dress. Her name is JENNY ROB and she is Sol's niece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you a friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a second stroke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's eyes drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max rushes into Sol s study. The room is covered with Sol research books. It seems Sol had recently come out of  retirement. Max looks at a few of Sol's books. Then he fi piece of paper with Sol's handwriting on it. On the paper THE number. Max slides it into his pocket. Max looks at the Go board. The pieces are arranged in a g spiral across the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sits on his bed staring at Sol's handwritten number. Then he notices that his thumb is twitching. He drops Sol note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, please! He dumps the contents of the bottle of pills into his han Max stops as he prepares to shove the pills down his thro He looks at the pills. Then he looks at Euclid around him throws the pills and the bottle to the floor. They fall t earth in SLOW MOTION. The room rushes in on Max and so does the pain. It throws to the ground and he bashes his head against the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Courageously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. I'm ready. I'm  ready! Show me! Max recites THE number and uses it to get to his feet. Th pain rips apart his voice. Max's pain and anger transform into violence. He attacks  Euclid furiously. He recites the number with rage in his  voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three, seven, two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smashes the old computer apart. He tosses his step sto through the mainframe. Then he goes to the window and tries to rip off the cardb covering the glass panes. Nothing doing, so he yanks the  entire window wide open. Sunlight floods the room and throws Max into the

dialogues.speaker: BLINDING WHITE VOID
dialogues.text: where Max looks around starry-eyed. The pain is gone.  Everything is new to Max - even his hands. The stress lea from his brow and his shoulders sag. Max continues to recite the number His voice becomes tend and peaceful. As he starts to become part of the void, hi voice turns into a whisper and his eyes start to close. Then he hears Devi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max. Max! Are you  okay!? Oh my God, Max! Her voice reaches into the void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max! Breathe, Max. Breathe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks toward her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Max. Listen to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cut back to

dialogues.speaker: ...THE MAIN ROOM
dialogues.text: where Devi leans over Max. Max's eyes are open while he  continues to recite the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathe, Max! Breathe.  Focus. Max turns away from Devi and we return to the

dialogues.speaker: BLINDING WHITE VOID
dialogues.text: where Max continues to recite the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Max. No.  Stay with me Max. Stay with  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we cut back to

dialogues.speaker: THE MAIN ROOM
dialogues.text: where Devi grabs Max's palm. Max's fingers wrap around he hand. We return to

dialogues.speaker: THE BLINDING WHITE VOID
dialogues.text: where Max stops reciting the number. He suddenly opens hi fear filled eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I? What is  this? This is wrong, Sol.  Sol!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max lets out a 'SOL!, and reaches out into the void. We m cut back to

dialogues.speaker: THE MAIN ROOM
dialogues.text: where Max grabs Devi and hugs her. He gasps for air as he collapses into her arms, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sol! You were right Sol!  He was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right Max. That's  Right. Breathe. Breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was right. I want to  breathe. Breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, breathe, Max.  Breathe... Max sobs. He holds onto her for dear life And then be realizes that Devi is not in his arms. He is  holding onto himself. Then Max notices Sol's note on the ground. He looks at th number. He collects himself and catches his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks at Sol's note. He lights a match and burns it. Next, he prepares something in the sink. We hear the WHINE of a motor. Then it stops, Max looks at himself in the mirror, He smiles. Then he gets solemn. He takes a deep breath. Then we hear the motor again. Max lifts up his arm. He's holding a drill. He places the bit against the math section of his scalp. He applies pressure and drills into his brain. Max collapses as we quickly

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON
dialogues.text: a tree branch gently blowing in the wind. Max watches it with peaceful, understanding eyes. He wear hat on his head. He listens to the wind in the trees. Just then, Jenna surprises him with her Fisher Price  calculator on hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, Max!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max smiles at Jenna. He's glad to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we do one, Max, can  we? Max shrugs, not able to say no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about two hundred  and fifty-five times a  hundred and eighty-three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenna types m the number. Max is about to say "no" to Jenna, but then be decides to it a shot. Max thinks, he really thinks. Jenna presses the EQUALS button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it! I got it!  What's the answer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Smiling and then laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I really don't  know. What is it, Jenna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
